Description: Foot and body sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery cup-skyphos; low, flaring ring foot; interior glazed; exterior: glazed, with reserved fillet on lower body; resting surface and underside reserved, the latter with miltos wash and central circle and dot.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Find-spot also noted in Hogarth's diary for19th April 1903; he writes 'Hermotimos', but this must be the piece.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 709, no. 674, pl. 25.9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1529)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
